channel.title: Al Tolerance on funPlantGenes
channel.description: Recent content in Al Tolerance on funPlantGenes

item.title: AhFRDL1
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: Gene Symbol: AhFRDL1 Gene Name: Genome: Species: Arachis hypogaea Functional Descriptions: AhFRDL1-mediated citrate secretion contributes to adaptation to iron deficiency and aluminum stress in peanuts.

item.title: ALMT1-1
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: Gene Symbol: ALMT1-1 Gene Name: aluminum-activated malate transporter Genome: Species: Triticum aestivum Functional Descriptions: Here, we report on the cloning of a wheat gene, ALMT1,that co-segregates with Al tolerance in F2 and F3 populations derived from crosses between near-isogenic wheat lines that differ in Al tolerance.

item.title: ALMT1-2
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: Gene Symbol: ALMT1-2 Gene Name: aluminum-activated malate transporter Genome: Species: Triticum aestivum Functional Descriptions: Here, we report on the cloning of a wheat gene, ALMT1,that co-segregates with Al tolerance in F2 and F3 populations derived from crosses between near-isogenic wheat lines that differ in Al tolerance.

item.title: ART1
item.description: Gene Details: MSU gene ID: LOC_Os12g07280 RAPdb gene ID: Os12g0170400 Gene Symbol: ART1 Gene Name: Genome: MSU7 , IRGSP-1.

item.title: ART2
item.description: Gene Details: MSU gene ID: LOC_Os04g08290 RAPdb gene ID: Os04g0165200 Gene Symbol: ART2 Gene Name: Genome: MSU7 , IRGSP-1.

item.title: BoMATE
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: Gene Symbol: BoMATE Gene Name: aluminum activated citrate transporter Genome: Species: Brassica oleracea Functional Descriptions: Brassica oleracea MATE (BoMATE) Encodes a Citrate Transporter and Enhances Aluminum Tolerance in Arabidopsis thaliana.

item.title: CcCS
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: Gene Symbol: CcCS Gene Name: Citrate Synthase Genome: Species: Cajanus cajan Functional Descriptions: CcNFYB3-CcMATE35 and LncRNA CcLTCS-CcCS modules jointly regulate the efflux and synthesis of citrate to enhance aluminium tolerance in pigeon pea.

item.title: CcLTCS
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: Gene Symbol: CcLTCS Gene Name: Long noncoding RNA Targeting Citrate Synthase Genome: Species: Cajanus cajan Functional Descriptions: CcNFYB3-CcMATE35 and LncRNA CcLTCS-CcCS modules jointly regulate the efflux and synthesis of citrate to enhance aluminium tolerance in pigeon pea.

item.title: CcMATE35
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: Gene Symbol: CcMATE35 Gene Name: Genome: Species: Cajanus cajan Functional Descriptions: CcNFYB3-CcMATE35 and LncRNA CcLTCS-CcCS modules jointly regulate the efflux and synthesis of citrate to enhance aluminium tolerance in pigeon pea.

item.title: CcNFYB3
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: Gene Symbol: CcNFYB3 Gene Name: Genome: Species: Cajanus cajan Functional Descriptions: CcNFYB3-CcMATE35 and LncRNA CcLTCS-CcCS modules jointly regulate the efflux and synthesis of citrate to enhance aluminium tolerance in pigeon pea.

item.title: CcSTOP1
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: Gene Symbol: CcSTOP1 Gene Name: SENSITIVE TO PROTON RHIZOTOXICITY1 Genome: Species: Cajanus cajan Functional Descriptions: Characterization of CcSTOP1| a C2H2-type transcription factor regulates Al tolerance gene in pigeonpea.

item.title: CsUGT84J2
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: TEA000239 Gene Symbol: CsUGT84J2 Gene Name: Al-induced glycosyltransferase Genome: Species: Camellia sinensis Functional Descriptions: Found that flavonol glycoside levels in tea roots increased following Al treatment, and the Al-induced UDP glycosyltransferase CsUGT84J2 was involved in this mechanism.

item.title: HvATF1
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: HORVU3Hr1G082560 Gene Symbol: HvATF1 Gene Name: Al-tolerance Transcription Factor 1 Genome: Species: Hordeum vulgare Functional Descriptions: HvATF1, Al-tolerance Transcription Factor 1, and determined its potential function in Al stress.

item.title: HvHOX9
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: Gene Symbol: HvHOX9 Gene Name: Genome: Species: Hordeum vulgare Functional Descriptions: Our findings suggest that miR166b/HvHOX9 play a critical role in Al tolerance by decreasing root cell wall Al binding and increasing apoplastic pH for Al detoxification in the root.

item.title: IDEF1
item.description: Gene Details: MSU gene ID: LOC_Os08g01090 RAPdb gene ID: Os08g0101000 Gene Symbol: IDEF1 Gene Name: Genome: MSU7 , IRGSP-1.

item.title: MdNAC2
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: MD03G122260 Gene Symbol: MdNAC2 Gene Name: transcription factor NAM ATAF and CUC 2 Genome: Malus × domestica GDDH13 v1.

item.title: MdSTOP1
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: MD05G1040600/MD16G1175800 Gene Symbol: MdSTOP1 Gene Name: SENSITIVE TO PROTON RHIZOTOXICITY 1 Genome: Malus × domestica GDDH13 v1.

item.title: MsDHN1
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: Gene Symbol: MsDHN1 Gene Name: Genome: Species: Medicago sativa Functional Descriptions: These results indicate that MsDHN1 can increase alfalfa tolerance to Al stress via increasing oxalate secretion from root tips, which may involve in the interaction of MsDHN1 with two AQP.

item.title: MsLEA1
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: Gene Symbol: MsLEA1 Gene Name: Late embryogenesis-abundant (LEA) 1 Genome: alfalfa genome(https://sciencedirect.

item.title: MsLEA1
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: MS.gene058705 Gene Symbol: MsLEA1 Gene Name: Genome: Species: Medicago sativa Functional Descriptions: These results indicate that MsLEA1 recruits and protects its target proteins (SOD and Ms1770) and increases alfalfa tolerance against drought and Al stresses.

item.title: SbMATE
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: Sb03g043890 Gene Symbol: SbMATE Gene Name: multi-drug and toxic compound extrusion Genome: Species: Sorghum bicolor Functional Descriptions: Sugarcane plants constitutively overexpressing the Sorghum bicolor MATE gene (SbMATE) showed improved tolerance to Al when compared to non-transgenic (NT) plants, characterized by sustained root growth and exclusion of aluminum from the root apex based on the result obtained with hematoxylin staining.
